It is headquartered in [[Tokyo]], [[Japan]] and markets [[Trend Micro Internet Security]], Trend Micro Worry-Free Business Security, OfficeScan, and other related security products and services. Eva Chen has been [[CEO]] for the company since 2005 succeeding Steve Chang, who is now [[Chairman]]. ==History== ===Foundation=== The company was founded in 1988 in [[Los Angeles]] by Steve Chang (å¼µææ­£, Chang Ming-cheng), his wife, Jenny Chang, and her sister, Eva Chen (é³æ¡æ¨º).{{cite web|url=http://us.trendmicro.com/us/about/company/index.html |title=Company Overview - Trend Micro USA |publisher=Us.trendmicro.com |date=2008-12-15 |accessdate=2011-11-25}} Shortly after establishing the company, its founders moved headquarters to [[Taipei]].http://taiwanreview.nat.gov.tw/ct.asp?xItem=117&CtNode=1354 In 1992, Trend Micro took over a Japanese software firm to form Trend Micro Devices and established headquarters in Japan. It then made an agreement with CPU maker [[Intel]] under which it produced an anti-virus product for local area networks (LANs) for sale under Intelâs name. Intel paid royalties to Trend for sales of LANDesk Virus Protect in the United States and Europe, while Trend paid royalties to Intel for sales in Asia. In 1993, [[Novell]] began bundling the product with its network operating system.http://taiwanreview.nat.gov.tw/ct.asp?xItem=117&CtNode=1354 In 1996 the two companies agreed to a two-year continuation of the agreement in which Trend was allowed to globally market the ServerProtect product under its own brand alongside Intel's LANDesk brand. ==Products== ===Consumer products=== The 2011-2012 range of products are [[Titanium Internet Security]], [[Titanium Maximum Security]] and [[Titanium Security for Netbooks]] as well as [[SafeSync|Trend Micro SafeSync]] and [[Online Guardian]]. There are also various versions for mobile devices, including [[Trend Micro Titanium Tablet Security for Android]], [[Mobile Security Personal Edition]], [[Smart Surfing for iPhone]] and [[SafeSync Mobile]]. The company also offers a variety of free tools to diagnose and mitigate security issues including [[HouseCall]], [[CWShredder]], [[Smart Surfing for the iPhone]], [[ThreatWatch App for iPhone]], [[RUBotted]], Rootkit Buster and [[HijackThis]]. ===Small business products=== Trend Micro offers Worry-Free Business Security and InterScan Messaging Hosted Security for small businesses. ===Enterprise products=== The 2010 Trend Micro Enterprise products include OfficeScan, InterScan Web Security, InterScan Messaging Security, and Deep Security. Trend Micro acquired the [[OSSEC]] project along with its acquisition of Third Brigade, and has promised to keep it open source and free.{{cite web|url=http://www.ossec.net/main/trend-micro-to-acquire-third-brigade|title=Trend Micro to Acquire Third Brigade}} ==Technologies== In June 2008, Trend Micro introduced Trend Micro [[Smart Protection Network]], a cloud-client content security infrastructure designed to protect customers from [[web threat]]s, such as [[data stealing malware]]. This combines in-the-cloud technologies with other client-based AV technologies to reduce dependency on conventional pattern file downloads on the endpoint.{{cite web|url=http://www.crn.com/security/208700393;jsessionid=LMHNO53QPXUT5QE1GHOSKH4ATMY32JVN|title=Trend Micro Releases New 'Smart Protection Network'|author=Stefanie Hoffman}} AVTest.org results from December 2009 testing show Trend Micro Office Scan ahead of the competition.{{cite web|url=http://us.trendmicro.com/us/trendwatch/core-technologies/competitive-benchmarks/avtest/index.html |title=Competitive Benchmark Tests â AV-Test.org - Trend Micro USA |publisher=Us.trendmicro.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-25}} Website administrators however report abusive behavior from the Trend Micro Network that is displaying [[malware]] characteristics. Reported behavior{{cite web|url=http://www.projecthoneypot.org/ip_216.104.15.138 |title=Project Honeypot |publisher=Project Honeypot |date= |accessdate=2011-11-25}} indicates security risks for users of [[Trend Micro Internet Security]] who access internet banking facilities. ==Mergers and acquisitions== *In May 2005: Trend Micro acquired InterMute Inc., a developer of anti-spyware products.{{cite web|url=http://us.trendmicro.com/us/about/news/pr/article/20070124151151.html|title=Trend Micro press release announcing Intermute acquisition}} *In June 2005: Acquired Kelkea Inc; an innovative encryption specialist based in St. Louis, Missouri, USA[http://us.trendmicro.com/us/partners/strategic-partners/mobile-armor/index.html Mobile Armor to be acquired by Trend Micro for expanded data protection] Trend Micro Inc. == Patent Lawsuits == Trend Micro is suing [[Barracuda Networks]] for the latter's distribution of [[ClamAV]] as part of a security package.{{cite web | url=http://www.linux.com/feature/126851 | title=Trend Micro patent claim provokes FOSS community, leads to boycott | publisher=Linux.com | date=2008-02-11 | accessdate=2008-02-12 }} Trend Micro claims that Barracuda's use of ClamAV infringes on a [[software patent]] for filtering viruses on an [[Gateway (computer networking)|Internet gateway]]. The [[free software community]] has responded in part by calling for a [[boycott]] of Trend Micro.
